Text.Value: When you told me about Rolan, I didn't believe you. But it's true...

EditorData.NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Text.Value: I did what I could to save him.
Things will be rough, probably for a long time, but Rolan and I will be all right - thanks to you.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad smile (his sister is dead) but filled with gratitude to the player for both saving him and for calming the fight between him and rolan

Text.Value: I hope all of this is coming to an end. We need a win - badly.

EditorData.NodeContext: cautiously hopeful

Text.Value: I wish we were parting under better circumstances, but thank you for helping us. I won't forget it.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying his best to be grateful but it's halfhearted.

Text.Value: Lia's dead. Rolan is gods-knows-where. This couldn't have gone more wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: panicked, grieving, wondering what to do, looking for guidance from the player

Text.Value: I'm fine, don't worry about me. I'm sure other people need you.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset and trying to hide it from the player

Text.Value: Thank you - I never thought I'd see these two again. It's good to be back.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice thick with gratitude towards the player

Text.Value: I know... but that doesn't matter, does it?

EditorData.NodeContext: shellshocked in his grief

Text.Value: Rolan could be stubborn, but he was never malicious. Not like you.

EditorData.NodeContext: despite his grief he feels pity for the player.
EditorData.logicalname: Lia alive but not in dialogue

Text.Value: You won't see me again.

EditorData.NodeContext: he's planning to walk into the cursed darkness to die - alone

Text.Value: Everyone I've ever loved is dead. I have nothing.

EditorData.NodeContext: shellshocked, unable to process what's happened

Text.Value: You don't need to say anything. I got Rolan's message.

EditorData.NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Text.Value: Lia spoke fondly of you. She'd be glad to know you stuck around.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad smile (lia is dead) trying to be cheerful

Text.Value: You're alive, aren't you? A little gratitude would be nice.
Rolan said to sit tight, but what's taking so long? I hope he's all right.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried, terrified something has happened to his brother

Text.Value: I hope you find happiness, or at the very least, learn not to be so very cruel.

EditorData.NodeContext: sad and pitying towards the player

Text.Value: Please don't. I have to leave - and there's nothing you can say to change my mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset and grieving

Text.Value: He died as he lived - stupidly.
I don't think I've ever seen Harpers move so fast. What in the hells is going down at Moonrise?

EditorData.NodeContext: concerned

Text.Value: I'm sorry.
Where is Rolan? He must be all right - he must.

EditorData.NodeContext: looking around for his brother, concerned
EditorData.logicalname: BUFFER: Needs to wait for full return

Text.Value: You saved me and I'm grateful, but I need some time alone right now.

EditorData.NodeContext: upset and trying to hide it from the player

Text.Value: If you see Rolan, could you let him know we're here? I'm getting worried.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried

Text.Value: We're leaving. It's what he wanted. As for you...

EditorData.NodeContext: sad sigh as he looks at the player

Text.Value: The person I admired most is dead - gratitude is the last thing I feel.
My big brother is dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: distant voice, he can't believe what he's just learned

Text.Value: If you ever need us, we'll be there - I guarantee it.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice thick with gratitude towards the player

Synopsis: Cal has been rescued from Moonrise Towers by the player and is now in Last Light. This dialogue covers multiple states: Rolan is missing, Rolan is dead, Rolan and Cal had a fight (player must pass a persuade to calm the fight, pass and fail states here), and a general state for when cal, lia and rolan are all alive and well and cal is grateful to the player.
